overview.keyMessage: Massachusetts taxpayers are paying among the highest costs in the nation while leadership makes decisions that prioritize political optics over fiscal responsibility

source.name: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio, Boston Globe, WBUR

keyFindings: EOHLC failed to adequately assess increased demand for shelter services
Improper and unlawful no-bid emergency procurements
No-bid contracts resulted in unnecessarily high costs and inefficiencies
Duration of no-bid contracts was excessive
Lack of transparency and accountability in contracting

quotes.quote: The middle class is carrying this state on its back, and getting nothing in return. While families are struggling to afford everyday necessities, the state is shelling out $15,166 per family per month.
quotes.speaker: Mike Kennealy

quotes.quote: Maura Healey completely mismanaged the migrant crisis, wasting hundreds of millions of taxpayer's hard earned dollars on bloated no-bid contracts.

quotes.quote: Where do we go to get our money back from these pricey no-bid contracts? Healey's team blew millions on shady, no-bid contracts, handed out sweetheart deals, and got taken for a ride, literally, with $150 cab fares and bloated food bills.
